corpus.text: Recursion in computer science is a programming technique where a function calls itself directly or indirectly to solve a problem by breaking it into smaller subproblems of the same type. Each recursive call processes a simpler instance until a base case is reached that terminates the recursion.
corpus.probe_question: What is recursion in computer science?

corpus.text: Recursion is when a function solves a problem by calling itself with smaller inputs until a base case is met.
Recursion: a function that calls itself until a base case.
